document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the Neotropical caddisfly genus Phylloicus (Trichoptera: Calamoceratidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the Neotropical caddisfly genus Phylloicus (Trichoptera: Calamoceratidae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Phylloicus pulchrus
Flint, 1964:65
[ Type locality: Puerto Rico , Maricao Forest ; NMNH; male].

subSubSection.paragraph:
Phylloicus pulchrus
is most similar to the other Antillean species
P. cubanus
,
iridescens
, and
superbus
. In
P. pulchrus
the orange bands of the forewing are wider ( Fig. 114 ) than in the other three species. The preanal appendage of
P. pulchrus
is shorter and the harpago is rounded apically ( Fig. 94A, B, C ).
